verse: This is what the Lord says: “Go down to the ·palace [house] of the king of Judah and ·prophesy this message [say this word] there:
‘Hear the word of the Lord, king of Judah, who ·rules from [sits on] David’s throne. You and your officers, and your people who come through these gates, listen!

This is what the Lord says: Do ·what is fair and right [justice and righteousness]. ·Save [Protect; Rescue] the one who has been robbed from the ·power [hand] of his ·attacker [oppressor]. Don’t mistreat or ·hurt [do violence to] the ·foreigners [resident aliens; Ex. 23:21; Lev. 19:33], orphans, or widows [Ex. 22:22; Deut. 10:18; 27:19]. Don’t ·kill innocent people [spill innocent blood; Deut. 19:10; 27:25] here.

If you carefully ·obey these commands [perform this word], kings who sit on David’s throne will come through the gates of this ·palace [house] with their officers and people, riding in chariots and on horses.
But if you don’t ·obey these commands [listen to these words], says the Lord, I swear by my ·own name [myself] that this ·king’s palace [house] will become a ruin.’”
This is what the Lord says about the ·palace where the king of Judah lives [house of the king of Judah]:
“People from many nations will pass by this city and ask each other, ‘Why has the Lord done such a terrible thing to Jerusalem, this great city?’

And the answer will be: ‘Because they [the people of Judah] ·quit following [abandoned; forsook] the ·agreement [covenant; treaty] with the Lord their God. They ·worshiped [bowed down to] and served other gods.’”
This is what the Lord says about Jehoahaz [Shallum; ruled 597 bc; 2 Kin. 23:31–33] son of Josiah who became king of Judah after his father left this place [died]: “He will never return.
He will die where he has been taken ·captive [into exile], and he will not see this land again.”
So this is what the Lord says to Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah:

“As surely as I live,” says the Lord, “·Jehoiachin [Coniah; ruled 597 bc; 2 Kin. 24:8–17; 2 Chr. 36:9–10] son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, even if you were a signet ring on my right hand, I would still ·pull [tear] you off.
I will ·hand you over to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and to the ·Babylonians [Chaldeans]—those people you fear because they ·want to kill you [seek your life].
I will ·throw [hurl] you and your mother who bore you into another country [Babylon]. Neither of you was born there, but both of you will die there.
They will want to come back, but they will never be able to return.”
